data.title: Speakers Asia — REM
data.text:
Ir. Mohd Razif Abd Halim | Managing Director | TNBX Sdn. Bhd

Razif is the Managing Director of TNBX Sdn. Bhd., a wholly owned subsidiary of Tenaga Nasional Berhad, Malaysia utility company. He holds Bachelors’ Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Masters’ Degree in Business Administration from Tenaga Nasional University. Razif is a registered professional engineer with Board of Engineers Malaysia and a registered member of Institute of Engineers Malaysia. He has served Tenaga Nasional for 21 years in various divisions and has vast experience in power plant projects, power and water desalination plant operation and maintenance, green field project biddings, O&M contract biddings and business developments in Malaysia, South East Asia, South Asia, Central Asia and GCC countries. Currently focusing on growing green energy and platforms under TNBX with Malaysian renewable energy certificate (mREC) as the main offer.

Allyson Browne | Climate Campaign Manager, Ports | Pacific Environment

Allyson Browne is Pacific Environment’s Climate Campaign Manager, leading their Ports for People campaign to end port and ship pollution. Allyson has contributed to renewable energy and climate policy for more than 10 years, including as Director of Regulatory Affairs for SRECTrade, where she collaborated with industry and grassroots organizations on renewable energy policies; as Chief of Staff to Jared Blumenfeld for California Governor Newsom’s 2018 gubernatorial campaign, Energy & Environment team; and as a consultant on energy in cities, cannabis, and cryptocurrency. Allyson holds a JD from GGU School of Law and a BS, Business Administration from USC Marshall.

Jessica Cheam | Founder and Managing Director | Eco-Business

Jessica is the Founder and Managing Director of Eco-Business, Asia Pacific's leading independent media and business intelligence organisation dedicated to sustainable development. She is recognised as a sustainability pioneer with two decades of experience in media, sustainable development and ESG issues globally.

She is a regular columnist for national newspapers and is on the Board of Directors for Singapore-listed ComfortDelGro, one of the world's largest land transport companies, as an independent non-executive director. She chairs the Group’s Board Sustainability Committee, and is a member of the Audit & Risk; and Digitalisation Committees.

She holds the CFA Institute Certificate in ESG Investing and the INSEAD Certificate of Corporate Governance. She is a member of the Singapore Institute of Directors (SID), and serves as its ESG committee member.

Orrin Cook | Managing Director | Apala Group

As Managing Director of Apala Group, Orrin Cook is focused on unlocking private sector demand to aid in the development of clean energy markets in Asia and Latin America. An expert in corporate climate and renewable energy solutions, Orrin has established new partnerships, programs and innovation projects to advance clean energy and supply chain decarbonization in these regions. Previously, Orrin led international market development engagements at CRS, supporting REC and tracking system infrastructure in Taiwan, Singapore, Hong Kong, China and other ASEAN and Latin American markets. Orrin holds a BSc from UC Berkeley and MA from University of Leeds (UK).

Kevin John Y. dela Cuesta | Market Development Manager | PEMC

Kevin is the Market Development Manager of the Philippine Electricity Market Corporation (PEMC), a non-stock, non-profit corporation that governs the Philippines’ Wholesale Electricity Spot Market (WESM) and Renewable Energy Market (REM). He holds Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of the Philippines, Los Baños. Kevin is a Registered Electrical Engineer and has experience in project management and conduct of market studies and simulations for the WESM and the REM. Kevin and his Team administers and operates the Philippine REM as the current Renewable Energy Registrar (RER).

Peggy Kellen | Director, Policy | Center for Resource Solutions (CRS)

Peggy Kellen directs the development and implementation of CRS’s sustainable energy policy and offers guidance on GHG accounting best practices. She brings over 10 years of experience designing renewable energy and GHG accounting policies and contributing to stakeholder engagement efforts for the electric power, energy efficiency, water, transportation and oil and gas sectors. Peggy is recognized as a leader in GHG accounting and has advised on the GHG reporting and verification requirements for the Greenhouse Gas Protocol, the American National Standards Institute, the States of California and Massachusetts, the Western Climate Initiative, US EPA, and the Government of Thailand.

Dr. Seungwan Kim | CEO | NEXT Group

Dr. Seungwan Kim is an associate professor of the Department of Electrical Engineering at Chungnam National University. He is also the Chief Executive Officer of NEXT Group, a non-profit policy think tank based in Seoul, Korea. Dr. Kim is known for his expertise in electricity system designs for zero-carbon energy transitions in Korea. He actively participates in Korea’s energy transition policy-making processes, serving as a member of the 2050 Presidential Carbon Neutrality Commission (2020-present), the Management Board of Korea Energy Agency (2020-2022), the Hydrogen Economy Council under the Prime Minister's Office (2020-2022), Expert Committee of the National Council on Climate and Air Quality (2019-2021). He holds a B.S. and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from Seoul National University.

Miho Kurosaki | Director | Kamakura Sustainability Institute (KSI)

Miho has been working in ESG and climate change since 2007 and advised policy makers including ministers, investors, companies on their ESG and climate change strategies based on analysis and data. She conducted research and analysis on Japan's energy market, policy and sustainable finance at BloombergNEF after working to develop Bloomberg's ESG product since 2009. Miho has delivered many public speeches including government committees and moderated international panel discussions such as in the G20. She is a fellow at International Global Environmental Studies (IGES) and Japan Climate Leaders' Partnership (JCLP), an independent advisor to RE100 and a director at Kamakura Sustainability Institute.

Miho holds an MSc in Environmental Technology from Imperial College London and a BA in Economics from Keio University in Tokyo.

Colin Li | EHS and Sustainability Director | AT&S (China) Co., Ltd

Colin Li has been working at AT&S (China) Co., Ltd. with over 20 years of EHS management experience. He holds a bachelor degree of Chemistry and MBA from Fudan University. Colin has held various positions throughout his career, including R&D Engineer, Environment Protection Engineer, EHS Manager, and his current role as EHS and Sustainability Director. He has been instrumental in implementing sustainable practices and emission reduction at AT&S (China) Co., Ltd. His goal is to continue improving ESG practices in the industry and help the company to win a sustainable future.

Kelvin Li | Head of Corporate Energy Solutions | CLP Holdings

Kelvin Li serves as Head of Corporate Energy Solutions at CLP Holdings to lead the business of green power solutions covering Power Purchase Agreements (PPA) and Green Energy Certificates (GEC) for companies in China, supporting them to decarbonize their operations and achieve net zero goals.

He holds over 20 years of experience in power utility, energy consultancies, and energy corporations. Before CLP Holdings, he had served as Director of Strategy and Business Development at Schneider Electric, formulating corporate strategies to drive business growth by leveraging innovative technologies for the energy industry.

Kelvin holds three master’s degrees – MPA from Harvard University, MBA from London Business School, and MSc from The University of Hong Kong. He was selected to attend The Prince of Wales's Business & Sustainability Programme at Cambridge University. He also got the designation as an Energy Risk Professional (ERP) in 2019.

Jennifer Martin | Executive Director | Center for Resource Solutions (CRS)

Jennifer Martin is the Executive Director of the Center for Resource Solutions, where she brings over two decades of NGO and private-sector experience in renewable energy policy and markets, energy efficiency, distributed generation, electricity markets and technology development, and electricity sector and climate change policy and regulation. She is a frequent speaker and expert advisor on renewable energy policy, voluntary and mandatory green power markets, renewable energy certificate systems, and carbon and renewable policy interactions. She serves on several governance and advisory boards, including the State-Federal RPS Collaborative, Re-Volv, Green-e, the Western Renewable Energy Generation Information System, and the Low Impact Hydro Institute. She completed her undergraduate degree at Pomona College and M.P.P. at Duke University.

Elvin Hayes E. Nidea | President | Philippine Electricity Market Corporation (PEMC)

Mr. Nidea is the current President of the Philippine Electricity Market Corporation (PEMC). A lawyer by profession, Mr. Nidea is a Managing Partner at the Nidea Law Office. He also served as a Senior Associate in the Tax Division at SGV & Co. and became a Member of the Board of Trustees of the Home Development Mutual Fund (Pag-IBIG Fund). He obtained his Bachelor’s Degree in Legal Management from the Ateneo De Manila University in 1994. He then earned his Juris Doctor Degree at the Ateneo de Manila College of Law in 1999 and was admitted to the bar in 2000.

Roble Poe Velasco-Rosenheim | Director, Partnerships and APAC Markets | I-REC Standard Foundation

Roble has a decade of experience supporting clean energy development in Asia and the Pacific. He is the Director of Partnerships and APAC Markets for the I-REC Standard Foundation, and the founder of SuSca Group and LockTwoThree.

Through these roles, Roble has enabled hundreds of entities to source renewable electricity in line with the RE100, Science Based Targets initiative, and other major reporting frameworks. Currently, he is focused on helping governments and utilities to engage in EAC markets through the globally recognized I-REC Standard, and on making Scope 2 and 3 emissions reporting more transparent.

Yuhuan Shen | Business Development Lead | South Pole

Yuhuan Shen is a Business Development Lead at South Pole. She has 15+ years of experience in clean energy, climate change and sustainability. Yuhuan has been responsible for advising multinational and Chinese corporate clients on their climate strategies and solutions including renewable energy procurement. She was also Energy and Low Carbon Lead of the UK government’s Prosperity Fund China Energy and Low Carbon Economy Programme and is a member of the Roster of Experts for both WB and ADB.

She holds a Master’s degree from the Renmin University of China and a bachelor's degree from Tongji University.

Rachael Terada | Director, Technical Projects | Center for Resource Solutions (CRS)

Rachael manages technical projects and initiatives for CRS and brings over 15 years of experience working in renewable energy markets. She leads the Green-e® Renewable Fuels certification program for biomethane. Rachael also leads technical paper development, international expert assistance to government agencies on renewable energy policy design, and support for renewable energy certificate (REC) tracking system initiatives. Rachael oversees the annual Renewable Energy Markets conferences in the U.S. and Asia and manages technical projects for the Green-e® certification programs. She received her M.S. and B.S. degrees in Civil and Environmental Engineering from the University of California, Berkeley.
